sentences.english: Provides a weekly report of any plant or equipment witch is Out Of Order and the action taken.
sentences.chinese: 提供發生故障的機房或設備的週報告以及採取的行動。

sentences.english: To realize the value of one week：Ask an editor of a weekly newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 要想知道一週的價值，那就去問週報的編輯。

sentences.english: I understAnd your concer , but remember that the offer ends next week.
sentences.chinese: 我瞭解您的擔心之處，然而別忘了下週報盤生效。

sentences.english: The EIA is to publish its weekly report on crude stockpiles.
sentences.chinese: 美國能源情報署將發佈原油庫存政府週報。

sentences.english: The study appears in the journal Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report.
sentences.chinese: 這項研究發表在《發病率與死亡率週報》上。

sentences.english: The News of the World is Britain's best-selling Sunday newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 《世界新聞報》是英國最暢銷的星期日週報。

sentences.english: Zang Shan, chief editor of New Epoch Weekly, said that a property tax is not justified.
sentences.chinese: 是新紀囗元週報的總編輯，說房產稅是不合理的。

sentences.english: Preparing the weekly and monthly sales report in time also in an accurate way.
sentences.chinese: 及時完成銷售週報及月報，確保信息的準確度。

sentences.english: Years later, I upgraded to a weekly newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 幾年後我去到一家週報工作。

sentences.english: A copy of the neighborhood weekly newspaper peeks out of a full container.
sentences.chinese: 鄰居的週報從一個滿了的垃圾桶中露出來。

sentences.english: The Program" page would have the weekly worship pamphlet."
sentences.chinese: 每週的崇拜周刋是在教會週報網頁。

sentences.english: It was the editor and proprietor of the SAGAMORE.
sentences.chinese: 來人是《薩加摩爾週報》的編輯兼老闆。

sentences.english: In 1621, an English newspaper was started in London and was published once a week.
sentences.chinese: 在1621年，倫敦每個星期都會發行一份週報。

definition: The Sun (the name of various newspapers, notably in the UK and in Hong Kong)
Mainichi Shimbun, a Japanese daily newspaper
